title: Catalytic performance of modified carbon black on methane decomposition for hydrogen production
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,15656-15663
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA01486C, Paper
Open Access
Â  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Niuhu Zhou, Donglin Zhao, Qin Su, Qiongguang Li, Weiwei Zha, Shaojie Feng
Heat treatment changes the carbon structure, increasing the degree of graphitization and defects. Methane molecules gradually decompose at the graphitized edges of the carbon material (BAY clusters) to form ordered carbon and hydrogen.
